name: Polysubstance-Induced Serotonin Syndrome with Concurrent Opioid Withdrawal
chief_complaint: I feel like my body is on fire, I can't stop shaking, and I'm seeing things that aren't there - but I haven't used in 36 hours

lab_results.urine_toxicology: positive for MDMA, fentanyl, and sertraline

prognosis: Guarded - mortality risk 5-12% in severe cases; neurological sequelae possible if hyperthermia persists >2 hours
description: Life-threatening condition caused by excessive serotonergic activity in CNS and peripheral serotonin receptors, exacerbated by recent discontinuation of chronic opioid use. Results from pharmacodynamic interaction between MDMA (serotonin releaser), fentanyl (weak SRI), and sertraline (SSRI) with abrupt opioid cessation removing inhibitory modulation of serotonin pathways.
risk_factors: history of previous serotonin syndrome episodes
multiple_choice: Polysubstance-Induced Serotonin Syndrome with Concurrent Opioid Withdrawal
